questions.question: Who developed the Analytical Engine?
questions.explanation: The Analytical Engine was developed by Charles Babbage.

questions.question: What was the primary purpose of the Analytical Engine?
questions.option_b: To serve as a general-purpose programmable computing device
questions.option_c: To process data for scientific research
questions.explanation: The Analytical Engine was designed to be a general-purpose programmable computing device.

questions.question: Which of the following was used to program the Analytical Engine?
questions.explanation: The Analytical Engine was programmed using punched cards.

questions.question: What was the most complex program intended for the Analytical Engine developed by?
questions.explanation: Ada Lovelace developed the most complex program intended for the Analytical Engine.

questions.question: When was ENIAC implemented?
questions.explanation: ENIAC was implemented in 1945.

questions.question: What was the primary technology used in ENIAC?
questions.explanation: ENIAC was based on vacuum tubes, diodes, and relays.

questions.question: How much electricity did ENIAC consume?
questions.explanation: ENIAC consumed 150 kilowatts of electricity.

questions.question: What was the weight of ENIAC?
questions.explanation: ENIAC weighed 27 tons.

questions.question: Who invented the transistor?
questions.option_a: John Bardeen, Walter Brattain, and William Shockley
questions.explanation: The transistor was invented by John Bardeen, Walter Brattain, and William Shockley.

questions.question: What year was the transistor invented?
questions.explanation: The transistor was invented in 1947.

questions.question: Who invented the integrated circuit (IC)?
questions.explanation: The integrated circuit (IC) was invented by Jack Kilby.

questions.question: What year was the integrated circuit (IC) invented?
questions.explanation: The integrated circuit (IC) was invented in 1958.

questions.question: What was the first commercially available microprocessor?
questions.explanation: The Intel 4004 was the first commercially available microprocessor.

questions.question: What was the Intel 4004 designed for?
questions.explanation: The Intel 4004 was designed for use in electronic calculators.

questions.question: Who proposed the von Neumann architecture?
questions.explanation: The von Neumann architecture was proposed by John von Neumann.

questions.question: What is the key feature of the von Neumann architecture?
questions.option_a: Separate memory for data and instructions
questions.option_b: Storing programs and data in the same memory
questions.explanation: The von Neumann architecture stores programs and data in the same memory.

questions.question: What is the function of the address bus in a computer?
questions.option_a: Transfer data between CPU and memory
questions.option_b: Specify the address of memory or I/O
questions.explanation: The address bus is used to specify the address of memory or I/O.

questions.question: What is the function of the data bus in a computer?
questions.option_a: Transfer data between CPU and memory
questions.option_b: Specify the address of memory or I/O
questions.explanation: The data bus transfers data between the CPU and memory.

questions.question: What is the function of the control bus in a computer?
questions.option_a: Transfer data between CPU and memory
questions.option_b: Specify the address of memory or I/O
questions.explanation: The control bus carries commands from the CPU.

questions.question: What was the first member of the x86 family of microprocessors?
questions.explanation: The Intel 8086 was the first member of the x86 family of microprocessors.

questions.question: What was the external data bus width of the Intel 8086?
questions.explanation: The Intel 8086 had a 16-bit external data bus width.

questions.question: What was the clock frequency of the Intel 8088?
questions.explanation: The Intel 8088 could run at a clock frequency of 4.77 MHz.

questions.question: What was the external data bus width of the Intel 8088?
questions.explanation: The Intel 8088 had an 8-bit external data bus width.

questions.question: What was the main improvement in the Intel 80286 over the 8088?
questions.explanation: The Intel 80286 had a 16-bit external data bus, improving performance over the 8088.

questions.question: What year was the Intel 80386 introduced?
questions.explanation: The Intel 80386 was introduced in 1985.

questions.question: What was the bit-width of the Intel 80386?
questions.explanation: The Intel 80386 was a 32-bit processor.

questions.question: What was the first iPhone powered by?
questions.explanation: The first iPhone was powered by a 32-bit ARM11 processor.

questions.question: What was the clock speed of the ARM11 processor in the first iPhone?
questions.explanation: The ARM11 processor in the first iPhone ran at 412 MHz.

questions.question: What operating system did the first iPhone run?
questions.explanation: The first iPhone ran the OS X operating system.

questions.question: What was the screen resolution of the first iPhone?
questions.explanation: The first iPhone had a screen resolution of 320x480 pixels.

questions.question: What was the thickness of the first iPhone?
questions.explanation: The first iPhone was 0.46 inches thick.

questions.question: What was the battery type used in the first iPhone?
questions.explanation: The first iPhone used a 3.7V lithium-ion polymer battery.

questions.question: What was the primary advantage of transistors over vacuum tubes?
questions.explanation: Transistors were more reliable than vacuum tubes.

questions.question: What was the primary advantage of integrated circuits (ICs)?
questions.explanation: Integrated circuits (ICs) had lower power consumption compared to discrete components.

questions.question: What was the primary purpose of the Intel 4004 microprocessor?
questions.explanation: The Intel 4004 was designed to power electronic calculators.

questions.question: What was the primary innovation of the von Neumann architecture?
questions.option_b: Storing programs and data in the same memory
questions.option_d: Separate memory for data and instructions
questions.explanation: The von Neumann architecture introduced the concept of storing programs and data in the same memory.

questions.question: What was the primary function of the Analytical Engine?
questions.option_b: To serve as a general-purpose programmable computing device
questions.option_c: To process data for scientific research
questions.explanation: The Analytical Engine was designed to be a general-purpose programmable computing device.

questions.question: What was the primary technology used in ENIAC?
questions.explanation: ENIAC was based on vacuum tubes, diodes, and relays.

questions.question: What was the primary advantage of the Intel 8086 over the 8088?
questions.explanation: The Intel 8086 had a 16-bit external data bus, which improved performance over the 8088.

questions.question: What was the primary advantage of the Intel 80286 over the 8088?
questions.explanation: The Intel 80286 had a 16-bit external data bus, which improved performance over the 8088.

questions.question: What was the primary advantage of the Intel 80386 over the 80286?
questions.explanation: The Intel 80386 was a 32-bit processor, which improved performance over the 80286.

questions.question: What was the primary advantage of the ARM11 processor in the first iPhone?
questions.explanation: The ARM11 processor in the first iPhone had lower power consumption, making it suitable for mobile devices.

questions.question: What was the primary advantage of the OS X operating system in the first iPhone?
questions.option_b: Support for a vast range of applications
questions.explanation: The OS X operating system in the first iPhone supported a vast range of applications, enabling rapid development of new apps.
